intro: Armeria alliacea var. palearensis, commonly known as the palearensis thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It is often cultivated in rock gardens and coastal areas due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
